result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tamarion R Brinston

records.addlTxt:
2:01 PM Defendant Tamarion R Brinston appeared by video.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Tamarion R Brinston.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Nimmer does request a offer along with discovery in this matter. 
Atty Nimmer requests more time. 
State does not  have an offer in the file and today has sent over discovery.
Hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witnesses A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

3:59 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Tamarion R Brinston in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Tamarion R Brinston. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
